summary: A mistake led to the accidental release of personal details such as passport numbers from the United States President Barack Obama and 19 other world leaders who attended the G20 summit in Australia in November. These details were accidentally sent to local organizers of the Asian Cup football tournament in Australia, where they were destroyed immediately. The Department of Immigration and Border Protection acknowledged the breach and has taken measures to prevent similar incidents in the future.

article: (CNN)If ignorance is bliss, then America must be a pleasure junkie, because we sure are chasing that dragon. The most recent example:  A school in New York sought to celebrate "National Foreign Language Week" by having the pledge of allegiance read in a different language every day.  You get one guess as to what happened when it was Arabic day. Complaints came in from both Jewish parents and people who had lost family in Afghanistan, according to the school superintendent. What language do they
summary: In recent years, several schools in the United States have attempted to teach foreign languages in the pledge of allegiance, sparking controversy and protests from various groups. The latest incident occurred in New York, where a school sought to celebrate National Foreign Language Week by reading the pledge in different languages each day. However, when it was Arabic day, complaints were made by both Jewish parents and individuals who had lost family members in Afghanistan. The school superintendent apologized for the incident, leading to concerns about the impact of such practices on education and the ability to learn about other cultures.

article: (CNN)Britain's Prince Harry is preparing for a new chapter in his life. After nearly a decade with the British military, he has announced in a statement that he is leaving the armed forces. "Moving on from the Army has been a really tough decision," he said in a statement released Tuesday. "I consider myself incredibly lucky to have had the chance to do some very challenging jobs and have met many fantastic people in the process. ...[T]he experiences I have had over the last 10 years will stay w
summary: Prince Harry, formerly a soldier, is exiting the British Armed Forces and plans to pursue a civilian career. He was born into a military family and spent over a decade serving in the British Army, where he developed strong leadership skills and earned a rank of captain. In the coming months, he will serve in Australia, gaining practical experience and assisting wounded soldiers. While he will continue to be involved with royal duties, Prince Harry intends to dedicate himself fully to his new endeavors.

article: (CNN)"Hey dude -- can you turn your music down?" If anyone says this to you while you're wearing your earbuds, take note: You are probably endangering your hearing. More than one billion teens and young adults are at risk of losing their hearing, according to WHO (that's the World Health Organization, not the rock band). It's not just old folks who suffer hearing loss. Just by listening to music at what you probably think is a normal level, or hanging out in loud bars, nightclubs and music and s
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) reports that over one billion teenagers and young adults worldwide face the risk of permanent hearing loss due to excessive listening to music, attending noisy events, or using personal audio devices without proper safeguards. WHO analyzed listening habits of 12- to 35-year-olds in wealthier nations globally and found that nearly 50% of respondents listened to unsafe sound levels on personal audio devices, and approximately 40% were exposed to damaging levels of music and noise at entertainment venues. Exposing oneself to sound levels of 100 decibels, equivalent to the volume of city traffic, for extended

article: (CNN)Schools in New York City have decided to observe two Muslim holidays and close schools for them. After all, for decades, kids have gotten Christian and Jewish holidays off. Why not add Muslim holidays to the list? Conservative Family Research Council president Tony Perkins went predictably apoplectic, saying that it was evidence of "discrimination" against Christians.  To Perkins, "family" apparently does not include "non-Christian families."  Perkins' position is that kids get Easter and C
summary: New York City schools have chosen to observe two Muslim holidays, sparking controversy among some conservative groups. The mayor's decision has led to calls for discrimination against Christians, but the author argues that it is a misguided endorsement of religion by the secular state. The author also believes that the exclusion of non-Christian religions from official recognition is problematic and sends the wrong message about the importance of religion.

article: (The Hollywood Reporter)It's official: AMC is moving forward with its "Walking Dead" companion series in a major way. The top-secret drama, which went through the pilot process with the title of Cobalt, will join the flagship series on the network as the cabler continues to focus on scripted fare. In addition to ordering the pilot to series, AMC has preemptively renewed the drama for a second season. The first season will consist of six hourlong episodes — just like the flagship series did. The

WASHINGTON (CNN)During his upcoming speech to Congress, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will lay out the details of what he understands to be the nuclear agreement between world powers and Iran, hoping it will prompt lawmakers to question the administration and delay the March 24 deadline for a political agreement. A senior Israeli official traveling in Netanyahu's delegation, who was not authorized to speak on the record, said the Israeli government had "a good understanding of the ag
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to deliver a speech to Congress next week, where he plans to outline the details of the nuclear agreement between world powers and Iran, hoping it will prompt lawmakers to question the administration and delay the March 24 deadline for a political agreement. A senior Israeli official stated that the Prime Minister has a good understanding of the agreement and believes it is a bad agreement. The official also suggested that Netanyahu will urge lawmakers to pressure the Obama administration to push the deadline for a political framework agreement so more discussion can take place about the perceived dangerous deal that leaves Iran with the ability to develop a nuclear weapon down the line.

article: (CNN)During the three years that I was serving as a member of Tunisia's Constituent Assembly, I would frequently walk to work through the gate of the Bardo Museum so  I could get a glimpse of the mosaics, and perhaps enjoy the adjoining herb garden. The museum, in downtown Tunis, serves not only as a physical reminder of Tunisia's Roman, Jewish, Christian and Islamic heritage, but is also connected to the Tunisian parliament. I used to love these peaceful moments on the way to work. Sadly, they
summary: The Bardo Museum in Tunisia was attacked on Wednesday, resulting in multiple deaths and the evacuation of members of parliament. The museum serves as a reminder of Tunisia's diverse history, including its Roman, Jewish, Christian, and Islamic heritage. The attackers, who were linked to ISIS, opened fire on civilians, including those working in the museum, and are believed to have been active from a sleeper cell. The attack comes after ISIS released videos threatening Tunisia, and some politicians have called for stricter anti-terror laws. The Tunisian Institute for Strategic Studies recommends building on existing institutions to combat Salafi terrorists and engaging the Tunisian public in the fight

article: (CNN)In an unusual turn of events last week, a terror plot suspect's desire to talk to local media put him at odds with his attorneys and landed a Cincinnati television station in federal court. At issue was a taped audio interview with Christopher Cornell and whether the station could broadcast that interview. Cornell is accused of plotting to attack the U.S. Capitol. The 20-year-old  -- who claims in the interview that he is affiliated with ISIS -- was arrested on January 14, months after his

(CNN)Early to bed, and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy, and . . . a criminal? A sanitation worker in an Atlanta suburb already served two weekends in jail -- and faced several more until officials relented Monday-- after authorities charged him for doing his job too early in the morning. Kevin McGill, a garbage collector in Sandy Springs, Georgia, had been sentenced to a total of 30 days in jail for violating the city's noise ordinance that states that "trash collection must be condu
summary: A sanitation worker named Kevin McGill was fined $250 for working too early to collect trash in his city. He had to spend two weekend days in jail for this, and then the judge changed his punishment to just being locked up for a few days. McGill thinks working in the city should not mean spending time in jail.

article: (CNN)A manager at an Indiana Veterans Hospital has been placed on paid administrative leave after sending a "completely and totally unacceptable" email apparently mocking mental illness. The email, sent by Robin Paul, "in no way reflects the attitudes of our staff toward our patients," Roudebush VA Medical Center Director Tom Mattice said in a statement posted on the hospital's Facebook page. Paul, a licensed clinical social worker, had been managing the Seamless Transition Integrated Care Clini
summary: An employee at an Indiana Veterans Hospital, named Robin Paul, was placed on paid administrative leave after sending a highly critical and offensive email mocking mental illness. The email, sent to a team member in December 2013, featured four photos of an elf in various situations, including one where the elf appears to be self-medicating for mental health issues and another where the elf hangs from Christmas lights, suggesting suicidal behavior. Paul was later suspended, and a pending investigation is underway. Many veterans and mental health professionals have criticized Paul's actions, and the VA has apologized for the incident, although no formal disciplinary action has yet been taken

article: (CNN)Eastern Europe, here comes the cavalry. The U.S. Army says it will soon be sending armored Stryker vehicles on a 1,100-mile convoy through six European countries to show solidarity to allies in the wake of recent Russian actions in the Ukraine and Crimea that have Eastern Europe on edge. The move was first reported Thursday in the military newspaper Stars and Stripes. U.S. Army Europe posted the Stripes story on its website on Friday. The convoy is "a highly visible demonstration of U.S, co
summary: The US Army plans to send armored Stryker vehicles on a 1,100-mile convoy through six European countries to show solidarity to allies affected by recent Russian actions in Ukraine and Crimea. The convoy will involve troops and vehicles from the 3rd Squadron, 2nd Cavalry Regiment, who will be accompanied by the 12th Combat Aviation Brigade. The move is unusual due to the long-distance movement of heavy military vehicles like the Strykers by road instead of rail. The convoy will take place in Latvia and the Czech Republic before heading to Vilseck, Germany.

article: Port Gibson, Mississippi (CNN)An African-American man is found hanging from a tree in the Mississippi woods with bedsheets around his neck attached to a limb 15 feet above the ground. There's no chair in sight. His feet are 2 to 3 feet off the ground. His hands are not bound. Is this a suicide? Or is it a lynching -- a shadow from the South's history of racial violence re-emerging? Those were the big questions Friday, one day after authorities found a man's body with bedsheets around his neck in

(CNN)More than two decades as a judge, prosecutor and defense lawyer could not prepare Susan Criss for the Texas murder trial of millionaire Robert Durst. The aftermath of the sensational 2003 trial of the scion of a New York real estate empire in many ways upended the life of the 54-year-old Galveston County-born lawyer who presided over the case. Durst admitted at trial that he killed neighbor Morris Black in Galveston and chopped up the body. There was the awkward encounter with Durst in an u

(CNN)The recent controversy over a video showing University of Oklahoma students, who also were members of the Sigma Alpha Epsilon fraternity, reciting a racist chant revealed a key difference in approaches to parenting. The university said Levi Pettit and Parker Rice encouraged their brothers to sing the lyrics, which included multiple references to the "n-word" and mention of lynching. The two young men were expelled. And the fraternity was shut down. What caught my attention was the reaction
summary: The University of Oklahoma recently faced backlash after a video surfaced showing students from the Sigma Alpha Epsilon fraternity reciting a racist chant, which included references to the "n-word" and mentions of lynching. Two young men, Levi Pettit and Parker Rice, were expelled for their actions. Their families' reactions varied greatly, with the Pettits apologizing for their son's behavior, while the Rice family refused to speak publicly. The article highlights the importance of responsible parenting and emphasizes that individuals should take responsibility for their actions, but also acknowledges that there is a time when it's appropriate for parents to step back and let go of their responsibilities

article: (CNN)A documentary on the life of late singer Amy Winehouse will be released in Britain on July 3, just weeks before the fourth anniversary of her death, the film's production company says. "Amy" seeks to "truly capture not just the great artist that she was, but also the funny and loving person that most people didn't get a chance to know," the filmmakers said on Facebook after announcing the film in 2013. It will feature "extensive unseen archive footage and previously unheard tracks," Deadlin
summary: A documentary about the life of famous singer Amy Winehouse is coming out in Britain on July 3rd. This movie shows us what a funny and loving person Amy was, even though she passed away when she was only 27 years old. She made many beautiful songs that were very popular, and even though there wasn't much good press about her before she died, this movie wants to make people understand how special and talented she was.

article: Moscow (CNN)Russia's president shares "political responsibility" for the assassination of opposition leader Boris Nemtsov, the late politician's daughter said Friday in her first TV interview since his death in central Moscow last week. Zhanna Nemtsova, who said she has no faith in the Russian investigation into the killing, said she believes his death will only deter other opposition voices, rather than embolden them. "I cannot blame him (Putin) directly, (but) I would say that our authorities,
summary: Russian President Putin shares political responsibility for the assassination of opposition leader Boris Nemtsov, whose daughter, Zhanna Nemtsova, expressed skepticism about the investigation and urged caution against other opposition voices. Nemtsov, a former deputy prime minister and one of Putin's toughest critics, was assassinated in central Moscow last year. While Putin has called the killing a "disgrace" and vowed to bring those responsible to justice, Nemtsova doubts that will happen, citing lack of cooperation from the investigation.

article: (CNN)When I received an advance copy of a book called "Moody Bitches" last month, I was immediately intrigued. I have been called moody, and the "b" word, but never have both terms been used -- at once -- to describe me. (At least not that I know of!) Had I been labeled a moody "b" in the past, I certainly would have taken it as a major insult. But today, if someone called me that, I think I would say, "Thank you for describing who I am and who we, women, are. There is nothing wrong with being m

Montabaur, Germany (CNN)Co-pilot Andreas Lubitz's voice isn't heard in a recording of the final moments of Germanwings Flight 9525. But investigators say he was the one at the controls inside the cockpit, deliberately locking out the plane's captain and setting the plane on a crash course for the French Alps. Andreas Lubitz had medical note for day of crash, hid illness, officials say . The only sound the recorder picked up from Lubitz as the Airbus A320 went down, Marseille prosecutor Brice Rob

(CNN)Two former neighbors of Justin Bieber have filed a lawsuit against the pop star, claiming he and his bodyguards repeatedly harassed them and their family, vandalized their house with eggs and threatened them with anti-Semitic remarks. In the lawsuit Jeffrey and Suzanne Schwartz say Bieber hosted frequent loud parties and spat in Jeffrey Schwartz' face after he complained about the pop star driving his Ferrari at dangerous speeds down the street of their gated community in Calabasas, Califor
summary: Justin Bieber and his bodyguards have been sued by two former neighbors who say they were harassed, vandalized their house, and threatened with anti-Semitic remarks.

article: (CNN)Whoever wins the general election on May 7 will face international challenges reaching to the heart of a question that has bedevilled every London government since 1945: what is, or should be, Britain's role in the world? As one of World War II's victor countries, Britain helped shape the post-war international architecture. Notably, it gained a permanent seat, plus veto power, in the U.N. Security Council, which it retains to this day. But these battlefield laurels disguised fundamental we

(CNN)The world is watching for what could turn out to be either a historic achievement for international diplomacy -- or, just as easily, a disappointing failure -- as negotiators sit down this week in the tranquil lakeside city of Lausanne, Switzerland, to hammer out a framework nuclear deal with Iran before March 31. Here are some of the key things you need to know as the next major deadline approaches in the Iran nuclear talks: . 1. The road to Lausanne has been a long one. This latest round

(CNN)Winter will end. The sun will shine again. But if you can't stand another day of toe-numbing temperatures, start thinking about an escape to one of TripAdvisor's picks for the world's best beaches. The travel site announced 332 winners of its annual Travelers' Choice awards for beaches Wednesday. The awards are based on the quantity and quality of traveler reviews for beaches gathered over 12 months. In addition to a global winners list, top beaches are listed by regions and countries, incl
summary: The Travelers' Choice Awards for the world's best beaches have been announced, with Baia do Sancho on the Brazilian island of Fernando de Noronha earning the top spot for the second year in a row. Grace Bay in Providenciales, Turks and Caicos, has retained its ranking as the No. 2 Travelers' Choice beach in the world. TripAdvisor's top 10 beaches in the world include Baia do Sancho, Grace Bay, Rabbit Beach, Playa Paraiso Beach, Playa de Ses Illetes, Anse Lazio, White Beach, Flamenco Beach, Whitehaven Beach,

article: (CNN)It's been more than 13 years since 2,753 people were reported missing in lower Manhattan after the attacks on the World Trade Center. Although death certificates have been issued for all 2,753, the work to identify each victim continues. In fact, it's far from over: Some 40% of the victims have not yet been identified, according to the city's Office of Chief Medical Examiner. The most recent identified victim is Matthew Yarnell, a 26-year-old New Jersey native who worked for Fiduciary Trust
summary: This article discusses the ongoing process of identifying victims of the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Center, which occurred more than 13 years ago. Despite issuing death certificates for all 2,753 individuals, the task of identifying each victim has proven to be challenging, as 40% of the victims remain unidentified. Among those whose remains have not been identified, 26-year-old Matthew Yarnell, a New Jersey resident working for Fiduciary Trust, was the most recent to be identified. His mother expressed relief upon learning that his DNA matches, leading to the closure of old wounds and pains

article: (CNN)FIFA president Sepp Blatter has told Iran to end its "intolerable" ban on women attending football matches. Writing in the FIFA Weekly magazine published by world football's governing body, Blatter described the situation as one that "cannot continue." Iran's ban was put in the spotlight at the Asian Cup in Australia earlier this year, when thousands of female Iranian fans watched their team without restriction. At the match against Iraq, activists unfurled a banner showing the face of Ghon
summary: FIFA President Sepp Blatter has urged Iran to end its ban on women attending football matches, describing it as an intolerable situation that cannot continue. He believes the ban can change over the medium term, but nothing has happened since. Iran is in the running to host the 2019 Asian tournament, which could be affected by the ban. Blatter also criticized football's continental confederations for not electing any women onto their executive committees, which he says is a "macho" sport.

article: (CNN)There is a controversy brewing about Starbucks and its new "Race Together" campaign.  The ubiquitous coffee shop company was mocked for its decision to have its employees write the words "race together" on its coffee cups and start a discussion on race. But what's so bad about that?  Shouldn't we commend Starbucks for trying to be good corporate citizen, to walk the talk, as it were? Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz announced the company's new campaign this week, which he described as "an oppor
summary: A Starbucks campaign encouraging employees to write "race together" on coffee cups and start conversations about race has sparked controversy, with critics arguing that it is hypocritical and not representative of the company's true intentions. Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz has defended the initiative, saying it is an opportunity to address issues of race and promote empathy. However, some see it as a way for the company to capitalize on its popularity while avoiding genuine efforts to combat systemic racism. Others argue that the campaign is a step in the right direction and could lead to meaningful dialogue and change.

article: (CNN)Kanye West is known for rankling people on stage.  Now it's his turn to get a virtual smackdown. One music fan in the UK wants him out of the Glastonbury Festival so bad, he's started a petition to make it happen. In his petition, Neil Lonsdale describes the rapper as an "egotistical, maniacal, disgrace." He calls on organizers to replace the  "Yeezus" singer  at the Glastonbury Festival this summer. West is booked to headline the festival, which runs between June 24-28. His performance is
summary: A music fan from the UK has started a petition to get Kanye West out of the Glastonbury Festival because they think he's an "egotistical, maniacal, disgrace". They want him replaced with someone else who deserves to perform there.

article: (CNN)He doesn't wear a uniform or hold an official rank, but Hadi Al-Amari is a powerful military leader in Iraq. He leads the Hashd Al-Shaabi, a predominantly Shia paramilitary force doing much of the fighting in the critical battle to take Tikrit from ISIS extremists. Ousting ISIS from Tikrit is important for dozens of countries in the United States-led coalition trying to thwart the Islamist extremist group's quest to grow its caliphate. Iran isn't a part of this coalition, but it is also wor

(CNN)It's no secret that Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has a young, liberal fanbase that shows its devotion in distinctly millennial ways. Her positions on wage parity, same-sex marriage and women's rights (to name a few) have earned her the nickname "The Notorious R.B.G." thanks to a Tumblr of the same name dedicated to her. There are tattoos, muscle tees and YouTube serenades paying homage to the soft-spoken justice, who has been on the nation's highest bench for 21 years -- longer
summary: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, a Supreme Court Justice known for her work on issues like wage equality, same-sex marriage, and women's rights, has a large fan base among millennials who show their devotion through various means, such as tattoos, muscle tees, and online posts. One popular tribute is a Tumblr named "The Notorious R.B.G." featuring images and quotes from the justice. In honor of her 82nd birthday, many people have shared memes and other digital expressions of support for the justice.

article: (CNN)One of 10 people killed in the collision of two helicopters in Argentina, France's Florence Arthaud has been described as a "national treasure" by fellow sailor Shirley Robertson. "Florence held the hearts of her nation when she won the Route de Rhum in 1990 -- a crazy sprint across the Atlantic, alone in very fast boats, an event watched live across the country with millions coming to see their heroes set off," Mainsail presenter Robertson told CNN. Along with Camille Muffat and Alexis Vas
summary: Argentine, French and Italian sailor Florence Arthaud, who was killed in a helicopter crash in Argentina, is considered a national treasure by fellow sailor Shirley Robertson. Arthaud was one of three athletes, including Camille Muffat and Alexis Vastine, who died in the accident while filming a reality TV show for French broadcaster TF1. Robertson described Arthaud as "a brave and brilliant woman who inspired a generation of French sailors." She was the daughter of Jacques Arthaud, the director of the Arthaud publishing house.

article: (CNN)"Fraggle Rock," the long-in-the-works adaptation of the Jim Henson 1980s puppet TV show, is getting a shot in the arm with the help of Joseph Gordon-Levitt. The actor has come aboard to star in and produce the feature adaptation. He joins New Regency and The Henson Co., who also are producing. "Rock" was a Canadian series that became a hit internationally (it played on HBO in the U.S.). It followed the adventures of a group of cave-dwelling puppet creatures called Fraggles. In their world w
summary: The film adaptation of "Fraggle Rock," a popular children's television show from the 1980s, has received a boost with the involvement of Joseph Gordon-Levitt. He will be starring in and producing the feature adaptation alongside other production partners, including New Regency and The Henson Co. This marks a fresh start for the project, with new directors and writers expected to join the production team.

article: (CNN)Vladimir Putin lies. Blatantly. Publicly. And, apparently, without chagrin. But a year since the annexation of Crimea, what does that mean for the West's ability to deal with him regarding Ukraine? In February 2014, "little green men" -- the Ukrainian term for professional soldiers wearing Russian combat fatigues but no identifying insignia -- seized key installations and checkpoints around Crimea. The Russian President's website reported the following exchange at a March 4, 2014, news conf

(CNN)Muhammadu Buhari has ruled Nigeria before, as one of a line of military strongmen who dominated the country between 1966 and 1999. A military coup brought Buhari to power in late 1983 -- closing a brief period of popular rule by Shehu Shagari -- and another military coup ousted him from power in August 1985. Buhari's 20-month rule was known for what he described as a "war on indiscipline," a tough regime which some say was marred by human rights abuses. The 72-year-old  retired major genera

Washington (CNN)Updates on Scott Walker, Marco Rubio and John Kasich, an economic twist on the old adage "All politics is local," and an overseas vote where President Obama would love to see an anti-incumbent backlash -- those stories filled our Sunday trip around the "Inside Politics" table. The official White House line will be something like this: The Israeli people are making their choice, the United States admires their vibrant democracy and looks forward to a close friendship and strategic

(CNN)Hillary Clinton held a closed door meeting with President Barack Obama at the White House on Monday.  Although the former secretary of state, senator and first lady has not declared, it is treated as a foregone conclusion that Clinton is running for president. Likely to launch her campaign in April, Clinton is regarded as the front-runner — if not the only Democratic candidate — and the inevitable Democratic nominee. There is an assumption that since Clinton supported Obama, the black commu

(CNN)Food & Wine magazine has released its annual list of the best new chefs across America. Making the cut in 2015 are a chef with a doctorate in neuroscience, a one-time "Top Chef" contestant and a culinary artist who plays blues guitar in his free time. The 11 chefs and their restaurants, which will be profiled in the July issue of Food & Wine, span the country as well as the culinary spectrum, specializing in Spanish tapas, rustic Italian, modern American, farm-to-table and even the breakfas
summary: Food & Wine magazine has released its annual list of the best new chefs across America. The 2015 edition includes chefs from various backgrounds and cuisines, such as Olamaie (named for a grandmother), Betony, and Ribelle. These chefs have been cooking for five years or less and have taken risks while pleasing their customers. The chefs are inspired by their families and the past, but also look towards innovation and simplicity in their cuisine.

article: (CNN)Two extremists who attacked a landmark museum in Tunisia, killing 23 people, got weapons training at camps in Libya, an official said Friday. The suspects were activated from sleeper cells in Tunisia, Security Minister Rafik Chelly said. He did not say which group activated them, or with whom they trained. "They left the country illegally last December for Libya, and they were able to train with weapons there," he told private broadcaster AlHiwar Ettounsi TV. Like Tunisia, Libya saw its lon
summary: In Tunisia, two extremist attackers who caused a deadly attack at a museum killed 23 people. These men got weapons training in Libya. They were taken from secret groups in Tunisia and trained with weapons there. This is similar to what happened in Libya where extremists took over and harmed people. Tunisia has been affected by this, and people are trying to stop the bad guys and help the country.

article: (CNN)Team Cookie or Team Boo Boo Kitty? If you're a fan of the hit TV show "Empire," you will totally get that reference to one of the main rivalries on the series. If you aren't a fan, you may soon be in the minority. The show has become something of an industry phenomenon, with ratings growing every week. According to Variety, two weeks before the season finale, which is set to air on March 18, ratings were up 53% from its January 7 premiere in the coveted 18-49 demo and total viewership had r

(CNN)Christopher Nowak says none of his friends were surprised when he and his wife decided to use a down payment for a home on a monorail car instead. After all, this was no ordinary monorail car, and Nowak is not your average collector. This was the front cab of an original monorail train that transported millions of visitors throughout Walt Disney World in the 1970s and 1980s. The original Mark IV monorail trains were retired in 1989 to make room for a new generation of models, according to t
summary: The owner of a rare Disney-themed monorail car has posted it for sale on eBay for $260,000, with no bids received before it was removed from the site. The car, which is a vintage model used by Walt Disney World in the 1970s and 1980s, is now up for grabs on the internet.

article: (CNN)Madonna, saying something controversial? Perish the thought. The object of her scorn fighting back? Of course. The mayor of Rochester, Michigan, has written an open letter to the venerable pop star, taking her to task for saying she never wanted to go back the town where she went to high school. "I can't be around basic, provincial-thinking people," she told Howard Stern last week on his SiriusXM satellite radio program. You could almost hear the steam coming out of Mayor Bryan Barnett's ea
summary: Rochester Mayor Bryan Barnett wrote a letter to pop star Madonna, criticizing her for saying she didn't want to return to her hometown, which she attended high school. However, the mayor claims that Rochester's recent achievements are not typical of simple or provincial-minded people, and invites Madonna to visit the city.

article: (CNN)The widow of the man whose life was portrayed in the acclaimed film "American Sniper" has penned a heartfelt letter to him on their 13th anniversary. Taya Kyle posted her letter March 16 on the Chris Kyle Facebook page, where she proclaimed, "I miss you and I love you. I feel you in my heart and soul so strongly. I am more blessed to have been your wife than anything else in my life." "Today, I have a choice. I can bury myself under the covers and acknowledge the pain of missing you and mou
summary: Taya Kyle, the widow of Chris Kyle, a renowned sniper in the US military, expressed her deep affection and gratitude towards him on their 13th anniversary. In a heartfelt letter published on Chris Kyle's Facebook page, Kyle shared her thoughts about their relationship and emphasized that she is more blessed to have him as her husband than anything else in her life. She also mentioned that while she could choose to ignore the pain of missing him and mourning the future anniversaries without him, she would prefer to celebrate their memories together, as they had left her with a lifetime of beautiful and cherished experiences.

article: (CNN)Sam Smith does not want his weight to "Stay With Me." The Grammy-winning singer has shed 14 pounds and is crediting author Amelia Freer with his new slimmer look. Freer is a nutritional expert and writer of the book "Eat. Nourish. Glow." Smith gave her a shoutout on an Instagram photo that shows his weight loss. "Three weeks ago I met a woman who has completely changed my life," he wrote. "Amelia Freer has helped me lose over a stone in 2 weeks and has completely transformed my relationship
summary: The Grammy-winning singer, Sam Smith, has lost 14 pounds by following the advice of Amelia Freer, a nutritional expert and author of the book "Eat. Nourish. Glow." Freer has dedicated herself to helping others change their lives through healthier eating, having experienced the consequences of a poor diet firsthand. Smith credited Freer for transforming his relationship with food and losing over a stone in just two weeks.

article: Leicester, England (CNN)"God save King Richard!" A cry rings out in the bright spring air as the simple oak coffin of Richard III is carried away from the tower block-filled campus of the University of Leicester for the final time. The medieval monarch's skeleton has been kept at the university since its discovery beneath a council car parking lot in the city sparked excitement around the world in August 2012. But on Sunday the bones -- which have been studied by archaeologists and experts from

Washington (CNN) A huge Obama foreign policy decision, a big immigration question and interesting steps related to Hillary Clinton, John Boehner and Marco Rubio filled an informative Sunday loop around the 'Inside Politics' table. There's nothing like a signature hire to quiet those who think you might blink and skip the fight. At issue is Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida, who remains a single-digit blip in Republican polls. So weak have his early poll showings been that many GOPers to this day say t
summary:
Here's a summary of the news article:

- A significant Obama foreign policy decision and immigration questions are discussed.
- Hillary Clinton's relationship with Newt Gingrich is mentioned, along with her potential presidential campaign status.
- Marco Rubio's chances of becoming a Republican candidate are questioned, but a new hire signals his progress.
- Republican Congressman John Boehner plans to pass two important bills, focusing on health care and Medicare reimbursements.
- President Obama will meet with Afghan President Ashraf Ghani and consider delaying troop withdrawals.
- Both parties are debating immigration policy, with both sides vying for consensus and facing challenges.

article: (CNN)Things got testy on "CNN Tonight" when conservative commentator Ben Ferguson charged that rappers like Trinidad James are profiting off the n-word. "I'll be honest with you," Ferguson told James on Monday night. "I think you know that we should probably get rid of the n-word, but in reality, I think many rappers are afraid they will lose out on money and sales and street cred if they don't stop using the word." summary: Trinidad James, a rapper, was criticized by conservative commentator Ben Ferguson on CNN's "CNN Tonight" for using the N-word in his music. (CNN)Debra Milke spent 22 years on death row, convicted of conspiring with two other men to kill her son allegedly for an insurance payout. On Monday, a judge ruled that the Arizona woman is innocent and dismissed all charges against her. This makes Milke only the second woman exonerated from death row in the United States. More importantly, the judge's decision finally clears Milke after years of legal back-and-forth in a case where she steadfastly maintained her innocence. Key to the case's di
summary: Debra Milke, a woman who spent 22 years on death row for murdering her son, has been exonerated by a judge. The judge dismissed all charges against her due to prosecutorial misconduct, specifically involving a detective who lied under oath and withheld critical evidence. Milke was wrongfully convicted based on the testimonies of two men, who later admitted their guilt separately. Her release marks the second woman exonerated from death row in the U.S., and it sets an important precedent for ensuring fair trials and upholding the constitutional rights of defendants.

article: (CNN)Lee Kuan Yew, the founding Prime Minister of Singapore, died early Monday morning, according to a statement released by the office of Singapore's current Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong. He was 91. Lee passed away peacefully at Singapore General Hospital at 3:18 a.m., the statement said. He had been in the hospital with pneumonia since February 5. summary:
Singapore's former Prime Minister, Lee Kuan Yew, passed away on Monday at the age of 91 due to pneumonia. Born in 1923, he played a pivotal role in the establishment of Singapore in 1965 and served as its prime minister for over three decades. He is considered one of the greatest strategists of Asian affairs and is highly respected for his contributions to Singapore's transformation from a developing country to an internationally renowned business hub. Lee's body will lie in state at Parliament House from March 2nd until March 6th, and a state funeral will be held on Sunday.
